Name: MOUSE X-AXIS
Description: Allow the mouse X-axis to control an-aspect of the flight model.

Name: RELATIVE MOUSE X-AXIS
Description: Causes the mouse's position to centre-horizontally over time.

Name: MOUSE Y-AXIS
Description: Allow the mouse Y-axis to control an-aspect of the flight model.

Name: RELATIVE MOUSE Y-AXIS
Description: Causes the mouse's position to centre-vertically over time.

Name: RESET MOUSE
Description: Instantly centres the mouse.

Name: MOUSE SENSITIVITY
Description: Adjusts the sensitivity of the mouse-movement.

Name: RELATIVE MOUSE RATE
Description: Adjusts how quickly the mouse centres-in relative mode.

Name: MOUSE DEADZONE
Description: Adjusts the deadzone of the mouse-movement.

Name: MOUSE POWER CURVE
Description: Makes motion in the centre screen-more sensitive.-At 1.0, the indicator position is one-to--one with its effect.

Name: SHOW MOUSE WIDGET
Description: Show a widget that indicates what the-mouse is doing.

Name: SHOW MOUSE WIDGET
Description: Show a widget that indicates what the-mouse is doing.

Name: YAW AXIS
Description: Analogue input axis for controlling ship-yaw (turning left or right).

Name: DEADZONE
Description: Axis inputs below this value will be-ignored.

Name: YAW LEFT
Description: Digital input for yawing the ship left-(turning left).

Name: YAW RIGHT
Description: Digital input for yawing the ship right-(turning right).

Name: YAW INTO ROLL
Description: Enable a slight yaw action based on roll-Off no yaw into roll functionality.-On initial roll will apply a slight yaw-when you begin a roll.-On low roll will apply yaw only on a low-roll input and roll only on high roll

Name: YAW INTO ROLL-SENSITIVITY
Description: Adjusts how much of an effect On low-roll has.

Name: YAW INTO ROLL - FLIGHT-ASSIST OFF
Description: Enable a slight yaw action based on roll-input, when flight assist is off:-Default to standard controls use-whatever option is defined for normal-Off no yaw into roll functionality.-On initial roll will apply a slight yaw-when you begin a roll.-On low roll will apply yaw only on a low-roll input and roll only on high roll
